content: 1 irish chain quilt socks so many quilting patterns work beautifully as a knitted colourwork chart the irish chain has a distinctive diamond shape that is reminiscent of argyle when knit into a sock cast on your favourite vanilla sock and add this knit this classic quilting motif into the cuff don t have a go-to pattern use ours this is an intermediate-level knitting pattern we recommend having knitted in-the-round and/or knitted stranded colourwork before tackling this project needles 2 5 mm us 1 5 needles for the main part of the sock either dpns or long circular 80 cm 32 or longer from tip to tip for magic loop 2 75 mm us 2 needles for the stranded colourwork either dpns or long circular 80 cm 32 or longer from tip to tip for magic loop yarn 100g of fingering-weight sock yarn in your main colour mc 20-30 meters of fingering-weight sock yarn in your contrast colour cc we recommend a high colour contrast between yarns so that the pattern is easily visible notions darning needle scissors small stitch markers to sit on your needle for magic loop and/or locking stitch markers glossary bor = beginning of round cc = contrast colour dpns = double pointed needles k = knit k2tog = knit two together mc = main colour m1 = make 1 make 1 right or make 1 left will work p = purl p2tog = purl two together sl1 = slip 1 purlwise with yarn in back sl1wyif = slip 1 purlwise with yarn in front ssk = slip slip knit 2 pattern casting on using the smaller needles and mc cast on 64 stitches divide your stitches evenly on dpns or a long circular needle for magic loop place a small stitch marker on your right-hand needle if using magic loop or attach a locking stitch marker on your first stitch if you are using dpns these markers will indicate the bor make sure you haven t twisted your stitches and join in the round cuff work k2p2 ribbing for 1-1 5 leg knit 5 plain rounds make sure you still have 64 stitches before you start working the chart switch to larger needles join cc and work your chart starting in the bottom right corner we recommend you catch your floats for any stitch gaps wider than 5 stitches when you have finished knitting the full chart cut cc switch back to the smaller needles and mc and knit to the end of the round continue working the leg of your sock in mc by knitting every round stopping when the leg reaches desired length heel flap this section will be worked back and forth over half of your stitches we will put the other half of your stitches - aka the instep - on hold by the end of the heel flap you should have a square of fabric coming off the leg row 1 k32 turn row 2 *sl1wyif p1* repeat from *
